name: President James Polk Online Trivia | U.S. Presidents | 10 Questions

questions.text: What year was James Polk born?
questions.explanation:
1795.

	Yup, that's when he was born.

questions.text: What occupation did Polk have before he was elected president?
questions.explanation:
Lawyer.

	Seems like a lot of presidents were previously lawyers...

questions.text: What happened to the Liberty Bell during Polk's term?
options: It was photographed for the first time
questions.explanation:
None of these.

	The bell cracked in 1835, nine years before Polk became president, but in 1846 the crack widened, making the bell unringable.

questions.text: Of what political party was Polk?
questions.explanation:
Democratic.

	Who WAS from the Sneezer party? I forget.

questions.text: What year was Polk elected to office?
questions.explanation:
1844.

	What can I say? It was 1844.

George M. Dallas

	Henry Clay was his opponent in the elections.

questions.text: How far did Polk extend the nation's boundaries?
questions.correct: To the shores of the Pacific
options: One hundred miles to the west
questions.explanation:
To the shores of the Pacific.

	Rather large expansion, if you ask me.

questions.text: What important event occured in California during Polk's term?
options: Someone sneezed 100 times in a row

questions.text: What was James Polk's middle name?
questions.explanation:
Knox & knox.

	Rather odd middle name, I think...
